content: have 8 sl to the single_crochet that the first tentacle started from not the first sl or chs of tentacle sl and 8 chain first tentacle plus sl and 8 chain of next tentacle where to sl into at end of tentacle round now this is where it gets a little hard to explain the last round puts a single_crochet into the base of each tentacle which is actually the single_crochet st of r10 where the sl sts went into these new single_crochet sts will be put between the sl sts that attached the tentacles once you figure out where the sts go they will actually go in quite easily except the last one because there is an extra slip_stitch where you joined the end of r10 this last one just takes a little extra prodding to loosen up the strands these stitches spread out the tentacles so the octopus sits flat r12 chain 1 single_crochet in the base of each tentacle 8 single_crochet if you have a hard time finding the exact spot don t worry about it too much just work 8 single_crochet around evenly once you re done that round stuff the head with polyfil or fiberfil make one more single decrease to close the hole a little more then fasten_off with a long tail and stitch securely closed i weave the end in and out quite a bit to make a tight closure there you have it you can leave the tentacles loose or curl them up tight
